Detailed Description

The world represents an independent simulation of physics. It keeps track of a set of rigid bodies, and provides the means to update them all.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ World()

World::World ( unsigned  maxContacts,
unsigned  iterations = 0 
)

Creates a new simulator that can handle up to the given number of contacts per frame. You can also optionally give a number of contact-resolution iterations to use. If you don't give a number of iterations, then four times the number of detected contacts will be used for each frame.

Member Function Documentation

◆ generateContacts()

unsigned World::generateContacts ( )

Calls each of the registered contact generators to report their contacts. Returns the number of generated contacts.

◆ runPhysics()

void World::runPhysics ( real  duration)

Processes all the physics for the world.

◆ startFrame()

void World::startFrame ( )

Initialises the world for a simulation frame. This clears the force and torque accumulators for bodies in the world. After calling this, the bodies can have their forces and torques for this frame added.
